Notes.Text:
This update for libvirt fixes the following issues:

Security issues fixed:

- CVE-2017-5715: Fixes for speculative side channel attacks aka 'SpectreAttack' (var2) (bsc#1079869).
- CVE-2018-1064: Fixed denial of service when reading from guest agent (bsc#1083625).
- CVE-2018-5748: Fixed possible denial of service when reading from QEMU monitor (bsc#1076500).


Non-security issues fixed:

- bsc#1083061: Fixed 'dumpxml --migratable' exports domain id in output on SLES11 SP4.
- bsc#1055365: Improve performance when listing hundreds of interfaces.

Vulnerabilities.Description: Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and indirect branch prediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis.

Vulnerabilities.Description: libvirt version before 4.2.0-rc1 is vulnerable to a resource exhaustion as a result of an incomplete fix for CVE-2018-5748 that affects QEMU monitor but now also triggered via QEMU guest agent.
